data.text:
If you’re planning a trip to Singapore, you’ll likely find yourself relying on the Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) system to get around. One station you might want to check out is Promenade MRT Station Singapore. Located in the Downtown Core, this underground interchange station connects the Circle Line (CCL) and the Downtown Line (DTL), making it a convenient hub for exploring the city.

Getting to Promenade MRT Station Singapore is easy thanks to its central location. Situated underneath Temasek Avenue and adjacent to Millenia Tower, the station is just a short walk from several key attractions and locations such as Suntec City and the Marina Promenade. With its direct connections to both the CCL and DTL, you can easily travel to other parts of Singapore from here.

Once you arrive at Promenade MRT Station Singapore, you’ll find a range of facilities and amenities to make your journey more comfortable. From ATMs to shops and restaurants, there’s plenty to keep you occupied while you wait for your train. And with nearby attractions like the Singapore Flyer and the ArtScience Museum, you can easily spend a whole day exploring the area.

Key Takeaways

Promenade MRT Station Singapore is an underground interchange station connecting the Circle Line and the Downtown Line.

Located in the Downtown Core, the station is centrally located and easily accessible.

With a range of facilities and nearby attractions, Promenade MRT Station Singapore is a convenient hub for exploring Singapore.

Location and Accessibility

If you’re planning to visit Marina Bay, Downtown Core, or Marina Centre, the Promenade MRT Station is a great starting point. Located underneath Temasek Avenue and adjacent to Millenia Tower, the station is easily accessible by foot, bus, or taxi.

The station is situated near several key locations and attractions, including Suntec City, Singapore Flyer, The Float@Marina Bay, and the Marina Bay Street Circuit. It also serves the nearby Marina Reservoir area, making it a convenient stop for visitors looking to explore the waterfront.

If you’re coming from Nicoll Highway or Raffles Blvd, you can take the Promenade Stn Exit B to reach the station. Alternatively, if you’re staying at the Pan Pacific hotel, you can access the station through Promenade Stn/Pan Pacific.

The Promenade station is an interchange station on the Circle Line and the Downtown Line, making it a hub for commuters and tourists alike. With a depth of 43 meters below ground level, it is one of the deepest stations in Singapore, along with Bencoolen station.

Overall, the Promenade MRT Station is a convenient and accessible starting point for exploring the Marina Bay area. Whether you’re looking to shop, dine, or take in the sights, this station is a great place to begin your journey.

Transport Connections

Promenade MRT Station is conveniently located in the Marina Centre area, making it easily accessible by various modes of transportation.

If you prefer to take the bus, there are several bus services that stop at Promenade MRT Station, including Bus 75, 97, and 97E. You can also take the metro to get to Promenade MRT Station via the Downtown Line.

If you’re looking for a taxi, there are taxi stands located just outside the station, making it easy to hail a taxi and get to your destination quickly.

For those who prefer to travel by ferry or cruise, you can take a short walk to the nearby Marina Bay Cruise Centre, which offers a variety of ferry and cruise services to popular destinations.

If you need to transfer to another mode of transportation, Promenade MRT Station also offers cross-platform interchanges with other train lines, making it easy to switch from one train line to another without having to exit the station.

Overall, Promenade MRT Station offers a variety of transport connections, making it a convenient and accessible location for commuters and travellers alike.

Train Lines and Services

When you arrive at Promenade MRT Station, you’ll find two train lines that intersect here: the Circle Line (CCL) and the Downtown Line (DTL). The station is located in the Downtown Core, specifically in the Marina Centre planning subzone.

The Circle Line is Singapore’s first medium-capacity line, and it was opened in 2009. It is completely automated and driverless, and it will become a complete circle in 2026 with the opening of CCL6, which comprises three stations connecting HarbourFront to Marina Bay. The Circle Line Extension (CLE) is a branch of the Circle Line that runs from Promenade Station to Marina Bay Station via Bayfront Station. It was opened in 2012 and is stacked above the original Circle Line tracks.

The Downtown Line, on the other hand, is a newer line that was opened in stages between 2013 and 2017. It is operated by the SBS Transit, and it is the fifth Mass Rapid Transit (MRT) line in Singapore. The Downtown Line runs from Bukit Panjang in the north-west to Expo in the east, and it connects to the Circle Line at Promenade Station.

Promenade Station is an interchange station, which means that you can transfer between the Circle Line and Downtown Line trains here. There are four platforms at Promenade Station, with two serving the Circle Line and two serving the Downtown Line. The station is underground, and it is located near popular attractions such as Suntec City, Marina Square, and the Singapore Flyer.

Overall, Promenade MRT Station offers convenient access to many parts of Singapore, thanks to its location at the intersection of two important train lines. Whether you’re commuting to work, shopping, or exploring the city, you’ll find that Promenade Station is a great starting point for your journey.

Facilities and Amenities

Promenade MRT Station offers various facilities and amenities to make your travel experience comfortable and convenient.

Concourse

The Concourse level of the station features a range of amenities, including retail shops, ATMs and self-service machines, and top-up kiosks. You can also find public toilets at the Concourse level.

Website

If you want to plan your journey in advance, you can visit the SBS Transit website to access the Interactive MRT & LRT Systems Map. This map provides information about train schedules, routes, and nearby points of interest for any train stations.

General

Promenade MRT Station has three exits at ground level – Exit A, B, and C. Lifts at Exits A and C provide barrier-free accessibility for the disabled. However, Exit B is inaccessible to the disabled.

GIS

Located underneath Temasek Avenue and adjacent to Millenia Tower, Promenade MRT Station is an underground Mass Rapid Transit interchange station on the Downtown and Circle lines in Downtown Core, Singapore. The station serves several key attractions and locations such as Suntec City and the Marina Promenade, which the station is named after.

SBS Transit

Promenade MRT Station is operated by SBS Transit, which is responsible for managing and maintaining the station facilities and services.

Unique

One unique feature of Promenade MRT Station is its location. The station is situated in the heart of Singapore’s Downtown Core, making it easily accessible to several key attractions, shopping malls, and business districts.

Nearby Attractions

Promenade MRT Station is located in a prime location that offers easy access to some of Singapore’s most popular attractions. Whether you’re a tourist or a local, there are plenty of things to see and do in the area. Here are some of the nearby attractions you should check out:

Suntec City: This is a massive shopping complex that offers a range of shops, restaurants, and entertainment options. It’s a great place to spend an afternoon shopping or catching a movie.

Esplanade: Known as “The Durian” due to its distinctive shape, this performing arts centre is a must-visit for culture enthusiasts. It hosts a range of performances throughout the year, including theatre, dance, and music.

Stadium: The Singapore National Stadium is located just a short walk from the Promenade MRT Station. It’s a world-class stadium that hosts a range of sporting events and concerts.

The Float: This floating platform is located in Marina Bay and is used for a range of events, including the National Day Parade and the Formula One Singapore Grand Prix.

Flyer: The Singapore Flyer is a giant observation wheel that offers stunning views of the city. It’s a great way to see the city from a different perspective.

Marina Bay Sands: This iconic hotel and casino complex is located just a short walk from the Promenade MRT Station. It’s home to a range of restaurants, shops, and entertainment options.

The Float@Marina Bay: This floating platform is located in Marina Bay and is used for a range of events, including the National Day Parade and the Formula One Singapore Grand Prix.

Millenia Walk: This shopping mall offers a range of high-end shops and restaurants. It’s a great place to go if you’re looking for luxury goods.

Centennial Tower: This skyscraper is located just a short walk from the Promenade MRT Station. It’s home to a range of offices and businesses.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I get from Promenade MRT to Suntec City?

Getting from Promenade MRT to Suntec City is easy and convenient. Simply take Exit C when you arrive at Promenade MRT Station and walk towards Suntec City. It is only a short 5-minute walk away.

What is the nearest MRT station to Bayfront MRT?

Bayfront MRT Station is located on the Circle Line and Downtown Line. The nearest MRT station to Bayfront MRT on the Circle Line is Promenade MRT Station, which is only one stop away. On the Downtown Line, the nearest MRT station is Downtown MRT Station, which is also only one stop away.

Are there any good food options near Promenade MRT?

Yes, there are plenty of good food options near Promenade MRT Station. You can find a variety of food options at Suntec City Mall, which is only a short walk away. There are also several food courts and restaurants in the surrounding area.

Where exactly is Promenade in Singapore?

Promenade MRT Station is located in the Downtown Core (Marina Centre planning subzone) of Singapore. It is situated at the intersection of Temasek Avenue and Raffles Boulevard.

Can you walk from Promenade MRT to Suntec City?

Yes, you can walk from Promenade MRT to Suntec City. It is only a short 5-minute walk away. Simply take Exit C when you arrive at Promenade MRT Station and walk towards Suntec City.

Which exit should I take to get to Millenia Walk from Promenade MRT?

To get to Millenia Walk from Promenade MRT Station, take Exit A. Once you exit the station, turn right and walk along Raffles Boulevard towards Millenia Walk. It is only a short 5-minute walk away.
